result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J. Banyasz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas J. Banyasz in court, in custody with attorney James R. Mack.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews stip. and recommendation, PQ&WOR, charges, penalties. Def pleads NC  to ct. 1 Felon Possess Firearm, and pleads NC  to ct. 2 Maintain Drug Trafficking Place. Court heard, finds pleas made FVK&I, accepts pleas and finds def guilty of ct. 1 Felon Possess Firearm, and guilty of ct. 2 Maintain Drug Trafficking Place. Enhancer on ct. 2 is dismissed. Atty Klomberg heard. Atty Mack heard. Def makes statement. Court heard and imposes sent of :
Ct. 1 - Felon Possess Firearm
9 yrs DOC
4 yrs IC
5 yrs ES
ERP Eligible
Challenge Incar. eligible
DNA sample
Costs
Treatment by Agent

Ct. 2 - Maintain Drug Trafficking Place
Sent w/h
3 yrs P&P consecutive
DNA sample
Costs
Treatment by Agent
Atty Klomberg request that firearm & cash be deemed contraband. Court heard, firearm and cash deemed contraband and will be disposed of.
36 days pre sent credit
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2014 at 09:00 am.
from the court to the defendant's attorney
Dodge County Detention Facility Inmate Request to Judge

ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas J. Banyasz
Current: 216 W. Center Street, c/o Dodge County Jail, Juneau, WI 53039 United States  (Effective: 10-14-2014)
Prior: 112-1/2 Third Street, Beaver Dam, WI 53916

Defendant shall not possess any firearms.   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Restrictions on travel: Shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

1:06 - Defendant Nicholas J. Banyasz in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan (eligible).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $10,000 Cash bond with conditions:     The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Defendant shall not possess any firearms.   Restrictions on travel: Shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
